titleStmt.title: Edward D. Townsend, Special Orders, No. 251
CWG11573

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p:
WAR DEPARTMENT,
ADJUTANT GENERAL'S OFFICE,
Washington, July 27th, 1864.
SPECIAL ORDERS,
No. 251.

4. So much of Speical Field Orders, No. 28, January 31st, 1863, from Headquarters, Department of the Cumberland, as accepted the resignation of Surgeon I. W. Brady, 1st Kentucky Volunteers, on account of inefficiency, is hereby amended so as to omit the charge of inefficiency.

By order of the Secretary of War:
E. D. Townsend,
Assistant Adjutant General.

OFFICIAL:
E D Townsend
Assistant Adjutant General.

War Department.
Adjutant Genls Office
Washington July 27"/64
Townsend E. D.
A. A. G.
Order accepting resignation of Surg. Brady 1st Ky Vols. amended so as to omit the charge of inefficiency.
